Job Title: Analyst, Financial Planning & Analysis

Location: Fort Lauderdale, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Company Overview

Moss is a national privately held construction firm providing innovative solutions resulting in award-winning projects. With regional offices across the United States, Moss focuses on construction management, solar EPC, and design-build. The company’s diverse portfolio encompasses a wide range of sectors, including luxury high-rise residential, landmark mixed-use developments, hospitality, K-12 and higher education, justice, solar energy and battery storage, and sports. Moss is ranked by Engineering News-Record as the nation’s top solar contractor and one of the top 50 general contractors. Moss prides itself on a strong entrepreneurial culture that honors safety, quality, client engagement, and employee development. Its employees consistently rank Moss as one of the best places to work.

POSITION SCOPE AND ORGANIZATIONAL IMPACT

Moss’ FP&A Analyst supports the Manager of FP&A in providing the enterprise with value-added financial analytics. This hands-on corporate finance position reports to the FP&A Manager and is a key member of the corporate finance team. This individual is responsible for preparing forecasts and analysis of results in support of business objectives, assisting in the budget process, and providing executive reporting. The candidate must be a cross-functional team player, comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and able to think outside the box, while building and maintaining productive positive relationships with dispersed business units and management teams.

Essential Job Duties And Responsibilities

Responsible for the aggregation and preparation of various forecasts, for a fast-growing enterprise. Includes reconciliation of those forecasts to actual. Accurate forecasts will require discovering, compiling, and analyzing financial and nonfinancial dataComplete complex analysis, provide sensitivity analysis and data, and make sound recommendationsPrepare ad-hoc analysis and provide recommendations to FP&A Manager to report out findingsCommunicates relevant financial information on a timely basis to internal teamsPerforms other duties as assigned

Education And Work Experience

Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance preferredOne to two years’ progressive finance or big four experience, including involvement with complex spreadsheet modelsExcellent communication and critical thinking skillsStrong analytical skills; able to clearly link financial results to operational performance drivers, generate alternatives, and drive positive changeGood grasp of accounting concepts as they relate to corporate financial analysis and preparation of forecasted financial statementsDemonstrated ability to analyze and understand research from both public and private sourcesHigh-performing independent thinker with excellent critical thinking and communication skills, as well as the ability to work independently. Flexibility, initiative, time management, and organizational skills are criticalAttention to detail and works well with deadlinesExcellent customer service and problem-solving skills required. Ideal candidate is results and action orientedIntermediate Microsoft Excel skills with willingness to learn and improveProactive individual with strong ability to build and maintain relationships with all business leadersExposure to commercial construction and/or renewable energy construction management

JOB TITLE: FP&A ANALYST

JOB LOCATION: FORT LAUDERDALE, FL

CLASSIFICATION: FULL TIME – EXEMPT – SALARIED

REPORTS TO: MANAGER, FINANCIAL PLANNING & ANALYSIS

Moss is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
